sub_topic: Identifying the automorphism group of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph G: 

![graph](https://i.imgur.com/Lr5ebYn.png)

Find the automorphism group of G.
message_2:
An automorphism of a graph is a permutation of its vertices that preserves adjacency. The automorphism group of a graph is the set of all automorphisms of the graph.

In this graph, we have 6 vertices labeled A, B, C, D, E, and F. We can observe the following:

1. A and F are the only vertices with degree 1, so they must be fixed in any automorphism.
2. B and E are the only vertices with degree 3, so they must be fixed or swapped in any automorphism.
3. C and D are the only vertices with degree 2, so they must be fixed or swapped in any automorphism.

Now, let's consider the possible automorphisms:

1. The identity automorphism, which fixes all vertices: (A)(B)(C)(D)(E)(F)
2. The automorphism that swaps B and E, and C and D: (A)(B E)(C D)(F)

These are the only two automorphisms that preserve adjacency in the graph. Therefore, the automorphism group of G is { (A)(B)(C)(D)(E)(F), (A)(B E)(C D)(F) }.
